intro: Christensonella subulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Christensonella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, narrow leaves are adapted to reduce water loss, and it produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Christensonella subulata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
